item.title: When not to use a regex
item.description: The other day, I saw Learn regex the easy way. This is a great resource, but I felt the need to pen a post explaining that regexes are usually not the right approach. Let’s do a little exercise. I googled “URL regex” and here’s the first Stack Overflow result: https?:\/\/(www\.)?[-a-zA-Z0-9@:%._\+~#=]{2,256}\.[a-z]{2,6}\b([-a-zA-Z0-9@:%_\+.~#?&//=]*) source This is a bad regex. Here are some valid URLs that this regex fails to match: http://x.org http://nic.science http://名がドメイン.
